extendedInfo.description: This unique application is for all students across the world. It covers 89 topics of Environmental Engineering I in detail. These 89 topics are divided in 7 units.Each topic is around 600 words and is complete with diagrams, equations and other forms of graphical representations along with simple text explaining the concept in detail.This USP of this application is "ultra-portability". Students can access the content on-the-go from anywhere they like.Basically, each topic is like a detailed flash card and will make the lives of students simpler and easier.Some of topics Covered in this application are:1.	Environmental pollution2.	Scope of environmental science3.	Introduction of environmental pollution4.	Air pollution5.	Soil pollution6.	Marine pollution7.	Nuclear hazards8.	Biomass energy9.	Water pollution10.	Introduction to ecosystem11.	Forest ecosystem(terrestrial ecosystem)12.	structure and function of forest ecosystem13.	Desert ecosystem14.	Grassland ecosystem( terrestrial ecosystem)15.	Aquatic ecosystem16.	Marine or ocean ecosystem17.	Energy flow in ecosystem18.	Food web19.	Introduction of nutrient cycle20.	Carbon cycle21.	phosphorous cycle22.	biodiversity23.	Introduction of natural resources24.	Deforestration25.	Timer extraction & mining26.	Water resources27.	Hydrological cycle28.	Big dams benefits and problem29.	Energy resources30.	Solar Energy31.	Wind energy32.	Ocean energy33.	Introduction of Non-renewable energy resources34.	Nuclear energy35.	conventional thermochemical technologies36.	Gasification and porolysis37.	Scientific principals of biomass pyrolysis38.	The chemistry of Biomass pyrolysis39.	Reactor design for biomass fast pyrolysis40.	Land resources41.	Food resources42.	Conservation of natural resources43.	Water supply and sanitation44.	Introduction of Social issues and environment45.	Water conservation46.	resettelement and rehabilation of people47.	Climate48.	Green house effect49.	Acid rain50.	Ozone layer depletion51.	Nuclear accidents and holocaust52.	Waste and reclamation53.	Source of waste water54.	environmental legislation and laws55.	Introduction of Human population and environment56.	Population explosion57.	Environment and human health58.	Role of Information technology in environment 59.	Human rights and value education60.	demography61.	Overpopulation and carrying capacity62.	Solid Waste management63.	Disaster management64.	FLOODS, FOOD MANAGEMENT, CYCLONES AND EARTHQUAKES65.	Environmental Management Capacity Building (EMCB) Projects66.	ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT ASSESSMENT67.	PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT TECHNIQUES68.	OBJECTIVE OF PUBLIC PARTICIPATION69.	PLANNING AS A PROCESS OF SOCIAL CHANGE70.	THE CONCEPT OF THE PUBLIC INTEREST71.	Status of EIA in India72.	Principles of Environmental Management73.	CHALLENGES IN  ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT74.	Conjunctive use of surface and ground water75.	Ground Water and Surface Water76.	Concepts of Ground Water, Water Table, and Flow Systems77.	GROUND-WATER MOVEMENT78.	INTERACTION OF GROUND WATER  AND STREAMS79.	Chemical Interactions of Ground Water and Surface Water80.	Affecting Transport of Chemicals in Ground Water and Surface Water81.	Water Resources Development in India82.	Projects Towards Better Management83.	POLICY AND STRATEGY FOR GROUNDWATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT84.	Innovative design and solutions for mine water85.	A possibility for drought mitigation in wetlands86.	Drought risk management in the Mediterranean87.	Indices of water availability assessment88.	Determinants of domestic water demand89.	Non-elastic matrix model for hydraulic networksAll topics are not listed because of character limitations set by the Play Store.
